snippet: Jurf al-Sakhar was recaptured from the Islamic State, but now Shiite-dominated forces say Sunnis cannot return to their homes for at least eight months.
abstract: Iraqi government's first big success against Islamic State, regaining of town Jurf al-Nasr in October, expelled militants but also all Sunni residents; Shiite security council prevents them from returning for at least eight to ten months, saying explosives left behind must be cleared; many Sunnis fear real reason for displacement may be an ethnic cleansing; fate of town may test commitment of newly formed Iraqi government to rise above sectarian politics.
lead_paragraph: Jurf al-Sakhar was recaptured from the Islamic State, but now Shiite-dominated forces say Sunnis cannot return to their homes for at least eight months.

headline.main: Sunnis Fear Permanent Displacement From Iraqi Town
headline.print_headline: Sunnis Fear Permanent Displacement From Iraqi Town

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
